form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Nelson introduced the following joint resolution; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations

form.official-title: To authorize the use of United States Armed Forces against the Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant.

section.text: This joint resolution may be cited as the Authorization for Use of Military Force against the Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant .

section.header: Authorization for use of United States Armed Forces against the Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant

subsection.text: That the President is authorized to use appropriate force against the Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) in order to prevent terrorist attacks on the people and interests of the United States and our allies.

subsection.header: No authorization for use of rotational ground forces
subsection.text: The authorization in this section does not include authorization for the use of rotational ground forces.
The authorization in this section shall expire on the date that is three years after the date of the enactment of this joint resolution.

paragraph.text: Consistent with section 8(a)(1) of the War Powers Resolution, the Congress declares that this section is intended to constitute specific statutory authorization within the meaning of section 5(b) of the War Powers Resolution.
Nothing in this resolution supercedes any requirement of the War Powers Resolution.
